page.title: 05FISHING
page.content: Mr.Buchan of the River Dee, said they normally catch about 700 cwt of fish a week. Their highest catch has been 1150 cwt.The heaviest fish they've caught is a 16\ stone halibut, but they mostly catch haddock.They have fished only 3 mile off shore but have also gone 400 mile for a catch.They usually send their catch to Aberdeen. When they are out at sea, they use auto pilot for steering.Sometimes the boat,with its 9 crew men (5 being ashore) can be at sea for 10 days but normally the boat goes for a week.Each crew man does about 33 trips a year. The boat has its own ice plant.He wears gloves when gutting the fish so that he won't cut himself.However he has been off work due to injury.He's even crashed the boat once.
